title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned: For an arrow directed toward Earth’s center

1 point is earned: For a correct label on the arrow representing the gravitational force, where the arrow is pointing toward Earth’s center

Note: A maximum of 1 point may be earned if extraneous forces are present.
descriptions:
Student response earns 0 of the following 1 point(s)

1 point is earned: For an arrow directed toward Earth’s center

1 point is earned: For a correct label on the arrow representing the gravitational force, where the arrow is pointing toward Earth’s center

Note: A maximum of 1 point may be earned if extraneous forces are present.

Student response earns 1 of the following 1 point(s)

1 point is earned: For an arrow directed toward Earth’s center

1 point is earned: For a correct label on the arrow representing the gravitational force, where the arrow is pointing toward Earth’s center

Note: A maximum of 1 point may be earned if extraneous forces are present.

Student response earns all of the following points

1 point is earned: For an arrow directed toward Earth’s center

1 point is earned: For a correct label on the arrow representing the gravitational force, where the arrow is pointing toward Earth’s center

Note: A maximum of 1 point may be earned if extraneous forces are present.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
PART i

1 point is earned: For using (or implying) Newton’s second law and equating the centripetal force to the gravitational force: F g =ma= m v 2 R        Gm M E R 2 = m v 2 R

1 point is earned: For explicitly or implicitly determining that the speed of the spacecraft is: v= 2πR T

1 point is earned: For a correct answer algebraically equivalent to: T= 4 π 2 R 3 G M E

Note: It is acceptable to leave answer in terms of T2 : T 2 = 4 π 2 R 3 G M E

PART ii

Correct answer: “Equal to”

Note: For an incorrect answer consistent with part (b)(i), the explanation is still graded

for consistency with part (b)(i).

1 point is earned: For a correct explanation that the period of the spacecraft does not depend on the

spacecraft mass (or only depends on the mass of Earth and the radius of the orbit)

OR an explanation consistent with the answer from (b)(i)

Note: The explanation must be consistent with the checked answer.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Correct answer: “Less than”

Note: If the wrong selection is made, the explanation is not graded.

1 point is earned: For a correct explanation of why speed decreases with increasing orbital radius

Example:

Derivation step in (b)(i) shows that speed decreases with increasing R.
